abstract: Felix G Rohatyn, former investment banker who played key role in rescue of New York City from financial collapse in 1970s, gives documents from that episode and other parts of his life to New-York Historical Society; collection includes letters between Rohatyn and several sitting presidents and other political leaders, along with documents from his childhood flight from Nazis.
lead_paragraph: In the 1970s, Mr. Rohatyn, an investment banker, engineered the rescues first of the New York Stock Exchange and then of the city itself, which was on the verge of financial collapse.

headline.main: Society to House Papers of Felix Rohatyn, Hero in New York’s Financial Rescue
headline.print_headline: Public Home for the Papers of the City’s Fiscal Savior

snippet: In the 1970s, Mr. Rohatyn, an investment banker, engineered the rescues first of the New York Stock Exchange and then of the city itself, which was on the verge of financial collapse.
